text: We have to get back to governing and get back to the issues that matter to the American people.

The time has come for everyone to put the American people above all interests. Let me be clear. Anyone voting no on today’s CR is voting to shut the government down.
I will be declining my pay in the event of a government shutdown. Members of Congress shouldn’t get paid while federal employees and our military have to work without a paycheck.

For me, this is about doing the work of the American people. It’s about governing as we were elected to do. And I will continue to do what is right, focus on reining in spending, and dealing with our border crisis.
Any CR should include provisions to secure our border. It’s that simple.

The plans by Biden and Hochul to ban gas stoves and further force homeowners to convert their homes from gas to electric would cost the average homeowner $35,000. Families in the Hudson Valley and across America cannot afford these radical and out-of-touch proposals.

Selling American reserves to adversaries like China both weakens our energy infrastructure and puts our security at risk. I was pleased to see the Protecting America’s Strategic Petroleum Reserves from China Act pass the House by a broad bipartisan margin this morning.

I appreciate @RepRonEstes’ office for inviting me and my team on a tour of the Capitol dome today. Thanks to the @visitthecapitol staff for a great experience and the Architect of the @uscapitol for all you do to preserve the historic heritage site that is our nation’s Capitol.

I’m proud to have been selected to serve on @FinancialCmte. I’m looking forward to working with Chairman @PatrickMcHenry and Committee members on both sides of the aisle on behalf of my #NY17 constituents and all Americans.

Proud to be selected to serve on the Financial Services Committee for the 118th Congress. With roughly 30,000 financial sector employees living in my district and the direct impact financial and housing policies have on New York’s economy, I will fight to protect our interests.
Today’s vandalism of the @RocklandPride Center is unacceptable. Hate has no place in our community.

I enjoyed chatting with Charlene Nijmeh, the Chairwoman of the Muwekma Ohlone Tribe of the San Francisco Bay. We had a productive discussion about challenges the Tribe is facing regarding its federal recognition status.

I stand in strong opposition to @GovKathyHochul’s dangerous plan to wipe away local control of zoning, which would have an immeasurably detrimental impact on communities across the Hudson Valley and on Long Island. This drastic overreach must be stopped.
We cannot sustain the level of debt we have incurred in recent years. I look forward to working with my colleagues in the House to finally get our spending under control.
My statement on the passage of the Family and Small Business Taxpayer Protection Act.

Tonight, I delivered my first floor speech, supporting the Family & Small Business Protection Act, which will repeal the 87,000 new IRS agents. We need to make New York and our country more affordable and shouldn’t use the IRS to target hardworking taxpayers. #CommitmentToAmerica

Today is National #LawEnforcementAppreciationDay. I am incredibly grateful to our law enforcement heroes for all they do to protect our communities. They put their lives on the line every day and it is imperative that we have their backs.

Congratulations Michael, Kenneth, and Jack Kowalski on receiving your Eagle Scout awards! Your service projects gave back to our community in a major way and reflect the values of service and volunteerism at the heart of the @boyscouts.

While it took a few days longer than expected, I’m proud to be officially sworn in as a member of the 118th Congress. It’s an honor to serve the constituents of #NY17. I look forward to working with colleagues on both side of the aisle and will always put the Hudson Valley first.
